content:
I have a small PR that would be useful for me to have merged by Thursday --- it makes one of my category theory exercises a bit less likely to get derailed. :-) Markus has already clicked "approve", but if a maintainer could take a quick look and put it on the queue that would be great.

I think there is more work to do in this direction, making it much more ergonomic to prove that cones of the different special shapes are limit cones, and I'll try starting on that again next week. This PR is a small step in the right direction, in any case.
@Scott Morrison The only comment I have is about names.
I don't have a very strong preference
I renamed the originals to _aux because now they are not used outside that file.
It's not entirely clear they deserve to continue to exist; they could be merged into the new is_limit.mk.
But if they are not used outside that file... how is this going to help your talk?
I think I'm slightly confused about that point
oh, because is_limit.mk is used outside this file, and is more useful than the old formulation.
The original .mk(') lemmas got renamed to _aux('), and there is a new, more specialised by also easier to use .mk.
I modified other files in mathlib to use the new one, and my exercise is easier with the new one.
Ooh, silly me. I hadn't even fully registered that the statement of .mk had changed :face_palm:
I was just thinking you were golfing proofs

I just realised that the content that I changed in this PR has corresponding parallel content in equalizers.lean (and missing parallel content in kernels.lean).

I'm leaving this note and starring it to remind me to fix these, too.
